Cavity module¶

Written by: Joao Rodrigues June 2020

class Cavity.Cavity(M, J)¶

Bases: object

A Cavity() object defines all the physical properties of the cavity, including details of both the photonic and molecular modes

load_dynamics(t, photons, gmols, emols)¶

Parameters:

t (numpy array): Array with time values. Shape is (n, ) photons (numpy array): Array with photon populations. Shape is (n, M) gmols (numpy array): Array with ground state molecular populations. Shape is (n, J) emols (numpy array): Array with excited state molecular populations. Shape is (n, J)
set_cavity_absorption_rates(rates)¶

Parameters:

rates (numpy array): Array of cavity absorption rates. Expected shape is (M,)
set_cavity_emission_rates(rates)¶

Parameters:

rates (numpy array): Array of cavity emission rates. Expected shape is (M,)
set_cavity_loss_rates(rates)¶

Parameters:

rates (numpy array): Array of cavity loss rates. Expected shape is (M,)
set_coupling_terms(coupling_terms)¶

Parameters:

coupling_terms (numpy array): Matrix with coefficients determining the coupling between the photonic and
molecular modes. Expected shape is (M, J)
set_reservoir_decay_rates(rates)¶

Parameters:

rates (numpy array): Array of reversoir decay rates. These are the rates of emission into non-cavity modes.
Expected shape is (J,)
set_reservoir_population(population)¶

Parameters:

population (numpy array): Array of reversoir population, i.e. the (total) number of molecules in each bin.
Expected shape is (J,)
set_reservoir_pump_rates(rates)¶

Parameters:

rates (numpy array): Array of reversoir pump rates. Expected shape is (J,)
class Cavity.Modes(grid_size, grid_delta, L0, q, n, n_modes)¶

Bases: object

A Modes() object defines the geometry of the cavity mirrors and calculates the respective mode structure.

compute_cavity_modes()¶

Parameters:

Return:
lambdas (numpy array): Wavelength of the cavity eigenmodes, in meters modes (numpy array): Cavity eigenmodes (squared amplitude of the wavefunctions).
get_cavity_grid()¶
get_coupling_matrix()¶
load_pump(pump)¶

Parameters:

pump (numpy array): 2D array with the pump shape. Dimensions must match the cavity grid shape
plot_cavity()¶
set_geometry(geometry)¶

Sets a user-defined mirror shape. The mirror shape array size must be compatible with the grid size and grid resolution defined. The mirror shape is defined as the spatially dependent perturbation of the cavity length (on top of L0). The units are meters. The geometry is set such that the longest cavity point corresponds to geometry=0, such that geometry(x,y) >= 0

Parameters:

mirror_shape (numpy array):
set_geometry_box(width, height, depth)¶
Parameters:
width (float): Box width, in meters. height (float): Box height, in meters depth (float): Feature depth, in meters.
set_geometry_circular_box(radius, depth)¶
Parameters:
radius (float): Spherical box radius, in meters. depth (float): Feature depth, in meters.
set_geometry_spherical(RoC, depth)¶
Parameters:
RoC (float): Radius of curvature, in meters. depth (float): Feature depth, in meters.
